  • Simpatico - Simulation Package for Polymer and Molecular Liquids

Polymorphic Base Classes

Simpatico defines several base classes that can be extended by users to implement new algorithms, molecular species or file formats. Among these are:

  • Species, which represents a molecular species.
  • Diagnostic, which represents a data analysis or output operation.
  • McMove, which represents a MC Markov move.
  • MdIntegrator, which represents an MD integration algorithm.
  • ConfigIo, which represents a configuration file format.
  • TrajectoryIo, which represents an MD trajectory file format.
  • Perturbation, which defines a free energy perturbation.

In order to implement, for instance, a new data analysis operation, the user must write a subclass of the Diagnostic base class, which must implement the interface defined by the base class. The required interface for each base class is described in the documentation for the base class.

There are also base classes for each of the different types of potential energy (pair, bond, angle, dihedral, etc). Users may also extend these classes in order to define new functional forms for the various types of potential energy. The procedure for doing so is, however, somewhat different than that required for the base classes listed above. Each potential energy function is defined by a non-polymorphic class that we refer to as an interaction class. Subclasses of each potential energy base classes are defined using a class template that takes an interaction class as a template parameter. These peculiarities of the potential energy classes are described in more detail here .
